advanced-fields-description: These fields are optional and can provide additional matching precision for specialized content types. Enable only the fields relevant to your use case.
advanced-interpretation-description: Intelligent content completion and source recognition
ai-disclaimer-detailed: Source Taster uses AI to extract and match references. Results may contain errors. Please verify accuracy before using them in academic work.
ai-model-description: Select the AI model to be used for the extraction.
ai-settings-api-key-help: You can get your API key from the provider's platform:
ai-settings-api-key-help-anthropic: You can get your Anthropic API key from the console:
ai-settings-api-key-help-google: You can get your Google AI API key from AI Studio:
ai-settings-api-key-help-openai: You can get your OpenAI API key from the platform:
ai-settings-api-key-hint: Enter and test your API key for the selected provider
ai-settings-api-key-required: API key is required to use AI features.
ai-settings-cost-warning: Using your API key will incur charges based on your provider's pricing. Monitor your usage on their platform.
ai-settings-invalid-api-key-format: Invalid API key format for the selected provider.
ai-settings-model-hint: Choose the AI model for processing. Higher-tier models offer better quality but cost more.
ai-settings-subtitle: Configure your AI provider and models
ai-settings-use-user-key-hint: Enable to use your own API key for unlimited usage. Disable to use limited demo functionality.
allow-author-format-variations-descripti: Match different author name formats and ordering styles
allow-date-format-variations-description: Match different date formats and representations
allow-journal-abbreviations-description: Match journal titles with their abbreviated forms
allow-page-format-variations-description: Match different page number formats and ranges
analyzing-references-description: We're searching for matching sources and checking them against your references. This may take some time depending on the number of references.
analyzing-text-content-description: The entered text is being analyzed. We're automatically detecting bibliographic references. This may take a while depending on the length of the text.
api-key-test-error: Unable to test API key - network error
api-key-test-failed: API key test failed - please check your key
api-key-test-success: API key is valid and working
api-key-texfield-message: Enter your API key here to use the AI extraction. If you don’t have an API key yet, you can
appearance-description: Adjust the appearance of the extension
auto-check-references-description: References are automatically extracted and checked as soon as text is pasted or a PDF is imported
auto-check-references-info: Manual checking via the button remains available
auto-import-references-description: References are detected on the open page and automatically imported in the extension
auto-import-references-info: This does not apply to downloaded PDFs opened in the browser; those must be imported manually
check-dois: Please check your input and ensure it contains DOIs and is correctly formatted to improve search results
connection-problem: There might be a problem with your connection. Please check your internet connection.
contact-email: For questions or issues, you can reach us via email
content-formatting-settings-description: Settings for formatting and standardizing bibliographic content
copy-identifier-tooltip: Copy the primary identifier (DOI, PMCID, etc.) to clipboard
custom-configuration-description: Configure your personalized extraction rules and preferences
custom-extraction-settings-description: Configure detailed extraction behavior for custom mode
custom-matching-settings-description: Configure detailed matching behavior and tolerance levels for custom mode
display-mode-description: Select the display mode of the extension
doi-incorrect: The DOI is incorrect in your source
doi-not-activated: The DOI has not been activated yet
doi-not-found: The DOI was not found. Possible reasons are:
early-termination-description: Automatically stop searching when a match with sufficiently high score is found
early-termination-threshold-description: Minimum score required to stop searching (higher values = more strict)
enable-fuzzy-matching-description: Allow approximate string matching for increased tolerance
enter-dois: Please enter DOIs, a text containing DOIs, or import a PDF containing DOIs to validate them
enter-references: Please enter a text or import a PDF containing references to verify them
error-reference: Reference could not be verified due to a technical error
error-references-tooltip: References that could not be verified due to a technical error
exact-match-threshold-description: Minimum score for green 'exact match' indicator
exact-match-threshold-example: 95% = scores 95-100% show as green exact matches
example-explanation: In this example, verification will focus 50% on title similarity, 30% on DOI match, and 20% on author similarity. All other fields (year, journal, pages, etc.) are ignored.
example-scenario: You want to focus only on title and DOI matching, ignoring all other fields
expert-settings-description: Configure advanced verification settings and field weights for metadata matching
extracting-dois-description: Extracting DOIs from the Text. Please wait...
extraction-mode-balanced-description: Fix formatting and typos but maintain content accuracy - perfect for everyday use

extraction-mode-balanced-tooltip.description: Systematically fix formatting and typos while maintaining content accuracy.
extraction-mode-balanced-tooltip.happens-1: Correct obvious typos and spelling errors (e.g., "Jouranl" → "Journal")
extraction-mode-balanced-tooltip.happens-4: Consistent formatting of author names and dates
extraction-mode-balanced-tooltip.not-happens-1: No content interpretation or meaning changes
extraction-mode-balanced-tooltip.not-happens-2: No addition of missing fields through guessing
extraction-mode-balanced-tooltip.not-happens-3: No modification of technical terms or specialized expressions
extraction-mode-balanced-tooltip.title: Balanced Mode Details

extraction-mode-balanced-tooltip-descrip: Systematically fix formatting and typos while maintaining content accuracy. Corrects obvious errors and standardizes formatting, but preserves original content meaning.
extraction-mode-custom-description: Build your own extraction rules and preferences - full control over AI behavior

extraction-mode-custom-tooltip.description: User-defined extraction configuration with personalized rules and preferences.
extraction-mode-custom-tooltip.feature-1: Choose exactly which corrections and normalizations to apply
extraction-mode-custom-tooltip.feature-2: Mix and match features from all other modes
extraction-mode-custom-tooltip.feature-3: Configure granular settings for typo correction, formatting, etc.
extraction-mode-custom-tooltip.feature-4: Perfect for specialized use cases and personal workflows
extraction-mode-custom-tooltip.title: Custom Mode Details

extraction-mode-custom-tooltip-descripti: Build your own extraction rules with complete control over AI behavior. Configure each extraction step individually to match your specific requirements.
extraction-mode-description: Choose how the AI should process and extract metadata from your documents
extraction-mode-strict-description: 1:1 extraction without corrections - ideal for quality control and plagiarism analysis

extraction-mode-strict-tooltip.description: Exact, character-by-character extraction of source data without any modification.
extraction-mode-strict-tooltip.happens-1: Extract metadata exactly as it appears in the text, character for character
extraction-mode-strict-tooltip.happens-2: Preserve all spellings, formatting, and structures exactly
extraction-mode-strict-tooltip.not-happens-1: No correction of typos or spelling errors
extraction-mode-strict-tooltip.not-happens-2: No normalization of capitalization or punctuation
extraction-mode-strict-tooltip.not-happens-3: No interpretation of abbreviations (e.g., "et a." remains "et a.")
extraction-mode-strict-tooltip.title: Strict Mode Details

extraction-mode-strict-tooltip-descripti: Exact, character-by-character extraction of source data without any modification. Extract metadata exactly as it appears, with no corrections, normalizations, or interpretations.
extraction-settings-description: Configure the extraction mode and select which metadata fields should be extracted during document extraction

extractionSettings.fieldSelectionDescription: Choose the metadata fields for extraction

mode.description: Choose the extraction mode for AI analysis
mode.title: Extraction Mode

extractionSettings.title: Extraction Settings

field-description-articleNumber: Weight for article number matching (electronic journals)
field-description-arxivId: Weight for arXiv ID matches (important for preprints)
field-description-authors: How important is author matching for reference verification
field-description-doi: Weight for exact DOI matches (highest confidence when available)
field-description-institution: Weight for institution matching (for theses, reports)
field-description-isbn: Weight for ISBN matches (important for books)
field-description-issn: Weight for ISSN matches (important for journals)
field-description-pmcid: Weight for PMC ID matches (important for medical literature)
field-description-pmid: Weight for PubMed ID matches (important for medical literature)
field-description-sourceType: Weight for source type matching (article, book, thesis, etc.)
field-description-subtitle: Weight for subtitle matching (important for German citation styles)
field-description-title: How important is title matching for reference verification
field-description-year: How important is publication year matching for reference verification
field-matching-configuration-description: Configure which fields are used for matching and their importance
field-matching-configuration-subtitle: Enable fields for matching and adjust their importance when verifying references. Only enabled fields are used for matching, and their weights must sum to 100%.
field-weights-description: Adjust how much importance each field has when verifying references. All weights must sum to 100%.
field-weights-explanation: Field weights determine how important each metadata field is when comparing references. Higher weights mean that field has more influence on the overall match score. The total must equal 100%.
flag-problematic-tooltip: Mark this reference as potentially problematic
format-variations-description: Allow different formatting styles for common bibliographic elements
formatting-structure-description: Author names, dates, and identifier formatting
found-references-tooltip: All references recognized in the text
fuzzy-matching-threshold-description: Set sensitivity for approximate string matching (higher = more strict)
general-description: Manage basic settings for the extension's functionality
high-match-threshold-description: Minimum score for orange 'high quality match' indicator
high-match-threshold-example: 70% = scores 70-94% show as orange high matches
idle-state-text: You have not entered any input yet or have not started the verification. Please enter text or import a PDF file and click on 'Verify'
ignore-case-description: Match text regardless of uppercase or lowercase letters
ignore-punctuation-description: Match text ignoring punctuation marks and special characters
ignore-whitespace-description: Match text ignoring spaces, tabs, and line breaks
import-pdf-or-add-references: Import a PDF file or paste references into the text field to start verification.
invalid-description: Invalid. Please check the DOI for accuracy
language-option-description: Select the language of the extension
match-quality-settings-description: Configure how match scores are visually represented with colors and indicators
match-quality-thresholds-description: Define score ranges for visual match quality indicators
matching-enable-fuzzy-description: Allow approximate string matching for text fields
matching-fuzzy-threshold-description: Higher values = more strict fuzzy matching (0.1-1.0)
matching-minimum-threshold-description: Minimum score required to consider a match valid (0-100%)
matching-mode-balanced-description: Case-insensitive with minor format differences allowed
matching-mode-balanced-tooltip: Moderate flexibility - allows common formatting variations while maintaining accuracy. Good for most academic sources.
matching-mode-balanced-tooltip-descripti: Case-insensitive matching with minor format differences allowed.
matching-mode-custom-description: User-defined matching rules and tolerance levels
matching-mode-custom-tooltip: Full control - configure all matching parameters to suit your specific needs and preferences.
matching-mode-custom-tooltip-description: User-defined matching rules and tolerance levels.
matching-mode-description: Configure how strictly sources are matched against references
matching-mode-strict-description: Exact matches only - every character, capitalization, and format must match precisely
matching-mode-strict-tooltip: Exact matching only - requires perfect correspondence between reference and database entries. No variations allowed.
matching-mode-strict-tooltip-description: Exact character-by-character matching. Every detail must match precisely.
matching-settings-description: Configure how references are matched against databases
matching-thresholds-description: Set minimum similarity scores and fuzzy matching parameters
matching-tolerance-mode-description: Configure how tolerant the matching should be when comparing references with sources
matching-tolerance-mode-subtitle: Choose the level of flexibility for source matching
minimum-match-threshold-description: Set minimum overall similarity score required for a successful match
minimum-match-threshold-example: 75% = references must be at least 75% similar to match
more-advanced-fields-description: Additional fields for highly specialized use cases (academic theses, translated works, etc.)
no-matching-source-found: No matching source found or verification failed
no-references-found-text: Please check the entered text or import a document with properly formatted references. Make sure that citation details are complete and correct.
no-references-found-title: Unfortunately, no references could be found
normalize-characters-description: Convert special characters to their standard equivalents

apiKey.description: To use The Source Taster, you need to provide an API key from a supported AI provider. Your key is only used for reference processing.
apiKey.hint: Enter your API key from your chosen provider
apiKey.info: Your API key is encrypted and stored locally in your browser. It is never shared with third parties.
apiKey.learnMore: Learn how to get an API key
apiKey.title: Configure Your AI Provider

validation.minLength: API key must be at least 10 characters

features.extraction: Extract references from text using AI

ready.description: The Source Taster is now configured and ready to use. You can start extracting and verifying references from any text.
ready.nextSteps: You can now paste text or import PDFs to extract and verify references.
ready.title: You're All Set!

welcome.description: The Source Taster helps you to extract and verify academic references using AI. Let's get you set up!
welcome.title: Welcome to The Source Taster

open-source-tooltip: Open the original source in a new tab
pending-reference: Pending verification. Please wait for the verification to complete.
quality-thresholds-description: Set the score ranges that determine when a match is considered exact, high, or poor quality
re-verify-tooltip: Run verification again for this reference
reference-score-description: Shows how well this reference matches the best-matching source found in academic databases (Crossref, PubMed, etc.).
reload-page-auto-import: Reload the page to automatically find and import references
remove-file-to-enable-text-input: Remove file to enable text input
requests-per-day-description: This is the limit of AI requests per day
requests-per-minute-description: This is the limit of AI requests per minute
search-and-verify-description: Searching for matching sources and verifying references...
search-on-web: Search the internet for this reference
setting-complete-incomplete-data-example: Add missing page numbers from range
setting-convert-to-title-case-example: "machine learning in healthcare" → "Machine Learning in Healthcare"
setting-interpret-incomplete-info-exampl: "et al." → full author list if available
setting-normalize-author-names-descripti: Format author names to a consistent style
setting-normalize-characters-description: Normalize corrupted or misencoded characters caused by encoding issues (e.g., UTF-8 artifacts)
setting-normalize-date-format-descriptio: Standardize date formats to ISO 8601 (YYYY-MM-DD) or similar formats
setting-normalize-identifiers-descriptio: Standardize external identifiers (DOI, ISBN, ISSN, PMID, PMCID, ARXIV) to a consistent format
setting-normalize-spelling-description: Correct obvious typos and misspellings, including common spelling errors, transposed letters, and missing letters
setting-normalize-title-case-description: Normalize capitalization of titles, names, and other text to standard formats (Title Case)
setting-normalize-title-case-example: "the quick brown fox" → "The Quick Brown Fox"
setting-normalize-typography-description: Fix common encoding issues such as smart quotes, em dashes, and other non-standard characters
setting-normalize-whitespace-description: Normalize whitespace by removing duplicated spaces, leading/trailing spaces, unnecessary tabs, and soft line breaks
setting-normalize-whitespace-example: "This    is a  test." → "This is a test."
setting-standardize-punctuation-example: Remove extra spaces, fix quote marks
subtitle: Subtitle
technical-extraction-settings-descriptio: Advanced technical extraction and error correction settings
technical-fixes-description: OCR errors, Unicode issues, and formatting problems
text-extraction-settings-description: Basic text cleaning and normalization settings
text-matching-options-description: Basic text comparison and normalization settings
theme-option-description: Select the theme of the extension
title: Title
tokens-per-minute-description: This is the limit of AI tokens per minute
tooltip-abstract: Brief summary of the publication's content (e.g. 'This study examines...')
tooltip-accepted: Date when the manuscript was accepted for publication (e.g. '2024-03-15')
tooltip-advisor: Academic advisor or supervisor (e.g. 'Prof. Dr. Schmidt')
tooltip-articleNumber: Unique article number (e.g. 'e2024001' in electronic journals)
tooltip-arxiv-id: arXiv identifier for preprints and scientific papers (e.g. '2024.01234')
tooltip-arxivId: arXiv identifier for preprints and scientific papers (e.g. '2024.01234')
tooltip-authors: List of authors who contributed to the work (e.g. 'Smith, J. & Doe, A.')
tooltip-chapterTitle: Title of a specific chapter in a book (e.g. 'Introduction to Machine Learning')
tooltip-citationCount: Number of times this work has been cited (e.g. '145')
tooltip-conference: Name of the conference where presented (e.g. 'ICML 2024')
tooltip-containerTitle: Name of the journal, book, or conference proceedings (e.g. 'Nature', 'Proceedings of ACL')
tooltip-degree: Academic degree for which the work was submitted (e.g. 'PhD', 'Master')
tooltip-department: Academic department associated with the work (e.g. 'Computer Science', 'Psychology')
tooltip-doi: Digital Object Identifier - unique persistent identifier (e.g. '10.1038/nature12373')
tooltip-edition: Edition number of the publication (e.g. '3rd edition', '2nd ed.')
tooltip-format: File format or media type of the publication (e.g. 'PDF', 'HTML', 'print')
tooltip-inPress: Publication is accepted but not yet published (e.g. 'true')
tooltip-institution: Academic institution associated with the work (e.g. 'Harvard University', 'Max Planck Institute')
tooltip-isbn: International Standard Book Number for books (e.g. '978-3-16-148410-0')
tooltip-issn: International Standard Serial Number for periodicals (e.g. '1234-5678')
tooltip-isStandAlone: Whether this is a standalone work (e.g. 'true' for monographs)
tooltip-issue: Issue number within a volume (e.g. '3', 'Special Issue')
tooltip-issued: Date when the publication was officially released (e.g. '2024-05-15')
tooltip-keywords: Keywords or tags associated with the publication (e.g. 'machine learning, AI, neural networks')
tooltip-language: Language in which the publication is written (e.g. 'en', 'de', 'fr')
tooltip-license: License under which the work is published (e.g. 'CC BY 4.0', 'MIT')
tooltip-location: Geographic location related to the publication (e.g. 'Berlin', 'New York')
tooltip-medium: Physical or digital medium of the publication (e.g. 'print', 'online', 'CD-ROM')
tooltip-openAccess: Whether the publication is freely accessible (e.g. 'true', 'false')
tooltip-original-title: Original title in the source language (e.g. 'Le Petit Prince' for 'The Little Prince')
tooltip-originalLanguage: Original language of the work (for translations)
tooltip-originalTitle: Original title (for translated works) - important for German citation styles
tooltip-pages: Page numbers where the article appears (e.g. '123-145', 'pp. 67-89')
tooltip-paragraphNumber: Paragraph number for sources without page numbers
tooltip-peerReviewed: Whether the work underwent peer review (e.g. 'true', 'false')
tooltip-pmcid: PubMed Central identifier for open access articles (e.g. 'PMC1234567')
tooltip-pmid: PubMed unique identifier for medical literature (e.g. '12345678')
tooltip-publication-place: Location where the work was published (e.g. 'Cambridge, MA')
tooltip-publicationPlace: Place of publication (important for German citation styles)
tooltip-publishedOnline: Date when the publication became available online (e.g. '2024-03-10')
tooltip-publisher: Organization or company that published the work (e.g. 'Springer', 'MIT Press')
tooltip-publisherPlace: Location where the publisher is based (e.g. 'Berlin', 'Oxford')
tooltip-references: List of sources cited in the publication (e.g. 'Smith (2020), Doe et al. (2019)')
tooltip-retracted: Whether the publication has been retracted (e.g. 'true', 'false')
tooltip-retrieval-date: Date when the source was accessed (e.g. '2024-07-12')
tooltip-retrievalDate: When the source was retrieved (for online sources)
tooltip-series: Publication series name (e.g. 'Lecture Notes in Computer Science', 'Studies in Linguistics')
tooltip-subjects: Academic subjects or disciplines covered (e.g. 'Computer Science', 'Medicine')
tooltip-submitted: Date when the manuscript was submitted (e.g. '2024-01-15')
tooltip-subtitle: Secondary title providing additional context (e.g. 'A Comprehensive Guide', 'Theory and Practice')
tooltip-supplement-info: Supplementary information about the publication (e.g. 'Supplementary Material', 'Appendix A')
tooltip-title: The main title of the publication (e.g. 'Machine Learning in Healthcare')
tooltip-url: Web address where the publication can be accessed (e.g. 'https://example.com/article')
tooltip-venue: Conference or event where the work was presented (e.g. 'NeurIPS 2024', 'ICML')
tooltip-volume: Volume number in a series of publications (e.g. '15', 'XXIII')
tooltip-websiteUrl: Official website URL of the publication (e.g. 'https://journal.example.com')
tooltip-yearEnd: End year for date ranges (e.g. '2020' in '2019-2020')
tooltip-yearSuffix: Additional suffix for the publication year (e.g. 'a', 'b' for multiple publications in one year)
unverified-reference: Reference could not be matched to a source. Please verify the reference manually
unverified-references-tooltip: References that could not be matched to a source
verified-reference: Reference could be successfully matched to a source
verified-references-tooltip: References that were successfully matched to a source
verify-reference-against-website-descrip: Enter a website URL to verify this reference against the website content
